This could have significant implications for the perception of time and the aging process.

This could have significant implications for our ability to communicate and detect electromagnetic radiation.

Reduced Gravitational Waves: Gravitational waves are ripples in the fabric of spacetime caused by the acceleration of massive objects. The speed of light is related to the frequency of gravitational waves, and if it were reduced by half, the frequency of gravitational waves would also be reduced by half. This could have implications for our ability to detect and study gravitational waves.

Changes in Cosmic Microwave Background Radiation: The cosmic microwave background radiation is the afterglow of the Big Bang, and it is one of the most important pieces of evidence supporting the theory of the Big Bang.
